Description: Body and base sherd (mended from seven fragments) of Chian pottery olpe; white slip; exterior: three wide black (fired reddish-brown) bands around centre of slim body; two short diagonal bands at base of vessel; underside reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the shape, see Boardman, J., Excavations in Chios 1952-1955. Greek Emporio. Annual of the British School at Athens Supplement 6. Oxford 1967, 144, no. 596, pl. 51, no. 596.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0060) (phase 2)
